intro: Gagea cuneata, commonly known as the narrowleaf gagea, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its grass-like foliage and small, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. Its bulbs are an important food source for certain pollinators and small mammals. Gagea cuneata is known for its ability to thrive in nutrient-poor soils and is often found in open woodlands and grasslands.
